You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Serve Bot-Enabled Versions of Storefront Pages

By default, storefront pages load data asynchronously. This implementation supports customized front-end experiences and back-end data delivery, but because the data loads asynchronously, bots can crawl the pages before all the data loads. As a result, search engines can miss some of your product and category content. To ensure that bots see all your products and categories, B2B Commerce for Visualforce can detect whether a visitor is a bot or regular site user. If the visitor is a bot, B2B Commerce for Visualforce can serve static, synchronously loaded, data-complete versions of certain pages.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

A search engine bot declares itself with a unique string ID in the User-Agent header in an HTTP request. Configure your storefront so that it evaluates this header value to determine whether the user is a human or a bot. In this way, your storefront can serve standard pages to human users and only bot-enabled pages to bot users.

Enable the storefront configuration setting for detecting bot users.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select User Interface (3).
Find the Use Bot User-Agent Matching configuration (4), and find its value (5).
If Use Bot User-Agent Matching is TRUE, this setting is already enabled on your storefront. Skip to step 2.
If Use Bot User-Agent Matching is FALSE or doesn't exist, continue to the next step.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	User Interface
Configuration	Use Bot User-Agent Matching
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Specify all the strings that you want to evaluate as bot IDs.
Find the Bot User-Agent 1 setting (1), and find its value (2).
NOTE The regular expression evaluates strings that can appear in User-Agent request headers. The default Bot User-Agent 1 value provides a good starting point.
(?i)bot|crawl|curl|dataprovider|search|get|spider|find|java|majesticsEO|google|yahoo|teoma|contaxe|yandex|libwww-perl|facebookexternalhit
However, we recommend that you override this default value with an expression that’s specific to your application.
Click Override (3) in the Action column.
In the New Page Setting window, modify the default regular expression in Value, and click Create.
NOTE Each expression must be a valid Apex or Java regular expression that uses text patterns, such as Googlebot\\/|bingbot. Because the expression is limited to 255 characters, you can specify up to 10 different expressions that supplement each other.
If necessary, create supplementary Bot User-Agent regular expressions.
Click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	User Interface
Configuration	Bot User-Agent n, where n is the lowest number that’s not already in use
Page	all
Value	Regular expression
Build and activate a new configuration cache.
TIP To view your bot-enabled Home page, Product List page, or Product Detail page in your browser, append &isBot=true to the end of the page URL.
Bot-Enabled Page Content
Because search engine bots don't care about all the possible content on a particular page, the bot-enabled storefront pages contain only the most search-relevant details. This content includes page-specific content and information from common page components, such as menus and breadcrumbs.
Override the Default Bot-Enabled Pages or Components
Fine-tune the HTML output of the searchable content served directly to search engine bots that are crawling your storefront pages. You can create your own Visualforce pages and components for serving bot-enabled content, and override the default bot-enabled pages and components that B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides. Ensure that search engines crawl the exact semantic content that you want them to see.
Create Simple Footer Content for Bot-Enabled Pages
The bot-enabled storefront pages automatically include page-specific content and content from certain components, such as the header and breadcrumbs. However, to include footer content in your bot-enabled pages, you must create a CC Rich Contents record with the appropriate values.
Create HTML Footer Content for Bot-Enabled Pages
To precisely control the HTML source of a bot-enabled footer, upload a static resource that contains your CC Rich Contents definition in JSON format. Although you can modify a CC Rich Contents record in Salesforce directly, the Content field has limited editing capability. With this method, you can specify HTML tags, apply CSS classes, and reference images uploaded in your static resource, instead of sourcing images from a URL.
